commit.message:
Properly specify version as 0.4.7

Even though there have been changes since the 0.4.6 release many years ago, `pos-tip-version` is still set to 0.4.6, and the Package-Version is not specified in a way which package managers seem to understand.

This fixes an issue where elpaca fails to install packages which depend on `(pos-tip "0.4.6")` even though this version of the package is installed.

Properly specify version as 0.4.7

Even though there have been changes since the 0.4.6 release many years ago, `pos-tip-version` is still set to 0.4.6, and the Package-Version is not specified in a way which package managers seem to understand.

This fixes an issue where elpaca fails to install packages which depend on `(pos-tip "0.4.6")` even though this version of the package is installed.

commit.message:
Mark a new version

Adding some info in the source file for consistency.

Fix showing tooltips with non-zero line spacing

x-max-tooltip-size uses rows, but it seems that they are internally
converted to pixels using character height, and if your text doesn't fit
it gets truncated.

This works as expected with no line spacing, but with non-zero spacing
the result of division will be a float that would previously get
truncated leading subsequently to smaller maximum height, cutting off the
last line of the tooltip.

So, round the row count up. Fixes #19.

Fix font attribute applied by pos-tip-show

Originally, the code would just provide string specifying frame font.
While fixing #10, I changed this to finding font using that string as a
font spec, because we actually needed a font object there. However, this
breaks again in Emacs 29 pretest -- find-font does not respect the font
size specified in the XLFD font name.

You could argue it's an Emacs bug, or you could just get the font object
from 'default face directly, which is supposed to be equivalent to the
frame's font parameter, thus skipping the find-font + font-spec dance
altogether.

Fixes #20.

commit.message:
Fix face attributes applied by `pos-tip-show'

The font parameter of a frame is a string, which is not a valid font
object, obviously. It can still be used as :font parameter of a face in
certain circumstances, but `propertize' calls seem not to be one of
those, leading to warnings about invalid face attributes.

So now `pos-tip-show' will actually construct a font-spec out of it, and
find the corresponding font object.

Fixes #10.

Merge pull request #7 from wasamasa/feature-use-tooltip-face

Fix the way `tooltip' face is used as a default for
`pos-tip-foreground-color', and `pos-tip-background-color'.

Documentation string fixes

Added missing space, and fixed inconsistent fill column.

Fix default foreground and background colours

It turns out that reading `tooltip' face parameters when providing
default values for defcustom-defined variables does not always work
correctly. In particular it causes certain problems when Emacs is
started in daemon mode, i.e., it doesn't have a graphical frame at
first, and then one is created.

This moves the behaviour of using `tooltip' face by default to point of
use of `pos-tip-foreground-color', and `pos-tip-background-color',
adding a new possible value for this, `nil', that will cause runtime
lookup of `tooltip' face properties.

Merge pull request #6 from wasamasa/fix-customizations

Turn settings into `defcustom` forms

Turn settings into `defcustom` forms

With this change every `defvar` form in the settings block will show up
correctly in a `M-x customize-group RET pos-tip RET` dialog.
Additionally to that the default face foreground and background are
inherited from the `tooltip` face.

Merge pull request #3 from syohex/fix-byte-compile-warning

Fix usage of function obsolete since 23.2.
fix byte-compile warning
Merge branch 'fix/fg-color-and-themes'

Fix problem when using pos-tip-show for the first time

When displaying first tooltip after starting Emacs, text attributes
would not be correctly applied, resulting in incorrect colour of tooltip
text and background. This would be visible only for the text, frame
foreground and background were set correctly.

This seems to have been related to the use of `make-face' to create a
temporary face for applying those text attributes. According to
documentation this function should not be used from Lisp source code. In
fact it turns out that there's no need to use a separate face at all: it
is sufficient to use a list of desired face attributes that should be
applied to text.

This fixes the problem and removes potentially costly operations
involving changing selected windows and manipulating face properties for
all the frames.

Fix setting foreground colour when using pos-tip-show

pos-tip-show would only pass the tip-color to pos-tip-show-no-propertize,
which resulted in applying it only to frame properties by x-show-tip, but not
to the font of the tooltip itself. This seemed to work actually, but only as
long as user did not choose a custom colour theme.

Otherwise it was impossible to set text foreground colour using
pos-tip-show. (You could not just propertize the text using face as
pos-tip-show replaces the face property of the input text.)

The solution is based on how tooltip.el uses x-show-tooltip: it does set
foreground-color and background-color frame parameters, but it also
additionally applies the tooltip face to the tooltip text.

Fix tip-color in pos-tip-calibrate-frame-offset

This ensures that tip-color constructed in pos-tip-calibrate-offset has
correct form, i.e., its background component is a string, rather than a lambda
that needs to be executed in order to get valid background colour.
fix for ELPA specification
